reviews.review: ANASHEI

Ну это шедевр в плане сюжета и его повествования. Сам геймплей приятно скакнул вперед и во многом очень упростился, хотя кому-то это будет в минус. Нету бесполезных взломов, нету бесполезных 100500 оружий и т.д. Игра намного проще, чем ее предшественники. Но сюжет и его развитие очень затягивают. Прошел за 2 дня на харде, игра даже показалась слишком легкой в плане геймплея, но для того, чтобы переварить сюжет, потребовался часик раздумий в довольно таки поникшем настроении.  В ней нет никого необычного в плане игровых механик, но за сюжет ставлю  от себя 10/10. P.S. Не встречал в играх лучше и полезнее компаньона, чем Элизабет. 10/10

My favourite Bioshock game. I enjoy the open atmosphere of the game compared to the dark grunge of the other BioShocks. Is it for everyone? Probably not. But if you like shooter games, eating hotdogs to recover from bullet wounds, and enjoy it when a pretty girl helps you loot a sky city so you can retrieve your daughter who you sold to pay your credit card debt then this is the game for you!
Quite a solid game

第九艺术品的代表作，只通关了一次。但感觉这游戏的剧情和整体思路世界线来看...是能出一本著作了。
游戏难度并不大，对技术要求不是很高。第一次玩可以最高难度直接入手。不过就是中途可能会死很多次（我不信幽灵夫人那一关能一命打过去。反正我幽灵夫人那关是调了一下难度再过的了）给即将入坑的萌新一个推荐，有钱多去升级常用的武器的威力子弹和效果。基本主角自带的技能可以不用怎么升级。有的时候子弹特别稀缺，有的时候你对抗的敌人掉落的子弹跟你用的不是同一种类型。所以必要时一定要去商店购买子弹（因为便宜）。
游戏是好游戏，如果想深入了解世界观和剧情。基本没个二周目以上也很难看得懂，除非你愿意花巨大量时间一周目时慢慢去整理。
Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt.

Esse jogo é tão bom quanto assistir a um bom filme ou ler um bom livro. A narrativa te leva para a progressão do jogo por querer entender o que está acontecendo com a cidade das nuvens, Booker DeWitt e Elisabeth, sendo o desenrolar disso tudo fantástico.

Apesar de ser um jogo de 8 anos ainda e de gerações passadas se mantém atual, é perceptível alguns serrilhados e texturas que para 2013 era normal, porém isso de forma alguma estraga a experiência, são apenas detalhes.

[spoiler] O final do jogo me deu o mesmo sentimento que interestellar [/spoiler]

Encore plus profond et plaisant que les autres Bioshock selon moi. Notamment grâce à l'ambiance de Columbia beaucoup moins oppressante que celle de Rapture.

"Щто я нэ понэл" - примерно эта мысль посещала меня на протяжении всей игры. Очень сложный для восприятия сюжет, интересно, но не понятно. Игра не даёт скучать - это факт, ты проникаешься персонажами - это то же факт, но понимание что я делаю и как двигаю сюжет - у меня не возникало на протяжении всей игры. Безусловно игра хороша, но видимо не для каждого ума. Графика красива, механики хороши, сюжет - сложен и лично для меня непонятен. жалко ли денег отданных за игру - нет, хочу ли я пройти её снова - нет.

“文艺至死的第九艺术，反乌托邦之伊甸园” “这里是天堂，或者是离天堂最近的地方”
       从“爱国士兵”“华盛顿雕像”“义和团运动”不难推断出所处时期以及影射的国家，作为一个崭新的国家，该国在发展的道路上充满了愚昧、偏见、以及鲜血和尸骨。
       如果再来一次，只想说:如果当时在海滩上醒来的时候，早知道后面的剧情不是去巴黎，不是看风景，不是跟伊丽莎白边散步边聊天，那我也许永远都不会打扰在沙滩上跳舞的伊丽莎白了。
       结局伊丽莎白向布克说道:There's always a lighthouse. Yeah it's the place where all the stories start.
       文艺至死，曲高和寡。

Efso

First things first.

Infinite as a standalone title - It's a great game. Gameplay wise, besides being limited to only being able to hold 2 guns, it's pretty decent. I will recommend this game, but don't jump into the game expect many similarities to the previous 2 series. Graphics is beautiful as well. Stealth wise, this game has none tho. Once enemies spotted you, they are pretty much stuck in aggressive mode even if you run out of the area. For DLCs, the gameplay is pretty decent as well(minus the storyline). CITC might/might not be fun depending on how you decide to approach it. Length of this game is decent as well. Like the previous 2 bioshock games, it encourages exploration with more ammo/health packs/salts/money or even infusion upgrade and the best vigor Return to Sender in those areas(this is close to the end of the game when you get this tho).

Infinite being tied to bioshock series - Bad. While the format they did to vigor was useful since you can now easily switch between the 2 vigors you used often, they now limit you to only being able to have 2 weapons on hand, which SEVERELY limits you to how you want to deal with different situations and enemies, let's not mention you can no longer hold extra health packs and salts so that you can use them when you really need them. People can argue "But you got Elizabeth!", sorry but I rather have the same systems as Bioshock 1 & 2 rather than rely on the tooth fairy named Elizabeth to dig up for resources while I run around trying to get around the health/salt/ammunition issues on hand with crazy soldiers shooting at me. The shield system does help to alleviate the issue of not being able to carry health packs somewhat, but when faced with a big horde of angry soldiers it sometimes doesn't help much tho. The upside is that at least in the BaS DLC, I can hold more than 2 types of guns/ammunitions. Some of the gears are pretty useful as well, with some being completely useless/not feasible in most situations. If you want to find a way to cheese through 1999 you might want to soft-reset the checkpoints at certain parts of the game to get the gear you desired since the game generates random gear pieces when you pick them up with the exception of a few fixed ones.

What I don't really like - is the storyline. The ending simply does not go well with me, and the DLC made things worse. The story linking to the bioshock series in the DLC feels "forced". Episode 1 you have a "Comstock" with the "AD" tattoo on his hand like Booker which makes completely ZERO sense. If anything, the DLC stories has caused more unanswered questions instead of concluding the story of infinite itself. Jumping through time/alternate realities can easily make or break the story, which this in fact breaks the story as it raises more unanswered questions.

As a whole, I will say, infinite is a great game, especially if it is a standalone title(not being related to bioshock series at all).
i cried
si

Kolumbien, die Traumstadt, ist wie der Protagonist Adliger, den der italienische Schriftsteller Italo Calvino in "Der Baron auf dem Baum" beschrieben hat. Die Stadt, die auf in der Luft schwebende Anti-Schwerkraft-Substanzen setzt, bricht aus vielen Zwängen aus und ergreift die Antigravitationsmaterial Der "Ballon" der Gravitationsmaterie schwebt schließlich zu den Wolken und taucht in Licht.

￼Der Charme, den Kolumbien den Spielern bringt, ist weit mehr als nur die traumhaften Lichter und Farben im Spiel. Freunde, die gespielt haben, sollten sich so gefühlt haben: Hinter dieser wunderschönen Stadt, die dem Himmel nahe ist, haben sich Chaos und Dunkelheit schon immer leicht verbreitet, so dass sich die Menschen selbst angesichts der wunderschönen Landschaft ein wenig in Trance und Unbehagen fühlen.


Die Kollision von Licht und Dunkelheit sowie die Infragestellung von Menschlichkeit und Freiheit in der Handlung lassen die meisten Spieler nach Spielende unerfüllt fühlen. Rein aus der Perspektive des Kunststils hat die Vorstellungskraft und Darstellung der Stadt am Himmel des Spiels jedoch bis zu einem gewissen Grad ihren Höhepunkt erreicht.

Faszinierende Welt. Alles faszinierend. Es hat wahrscheinlich wirklich die perfekte Kombination aus Kunst und Gameplay erreicht. Verschiedene Spieler können einen bestimmten Teil finden, der ihnen gefällt. Autor: Der Drachentöterjunge in Baomidi https://www.bilibili.com/read/cv5839318/ Quelle: bilibili

Tiene fallas? Si. Los mapas son muy lineales, el hecho de agarrar armas del piso es aburrido y lo único que logra es que no te encariñes con ninguna, y a veces se siente medio repetitivo por la mitad. Aún así la historia es el cierre de una de las mejores franquicias de la historia del gaming, con giros argumentales, personajes interesantes y mucho más.

Si jugaste al Bioshock 1 no te tengo que convencer, pero si no lo jugaste andá a jugarlo y después venite directo al Infinite que me lo vas a agradecer.

Edit post DLC: El primer DLC está muy bueno, el segundo tiene la mejor historia de los dos pero la realidad es que los cambios en la jugabilidad (pasa a ser un juego de sigilo de la nada) son horribles, así que el primero juegenlo como jugaron la partida original (en mi caso en difícil fue pero lo pueden poner en medio o 1999 si les dan los huevos) y el segundo ponganlo en fácil y disfruten la historia que este juego no fue pensado para jugarse sin que te vean y usando los checkpoints (osea sin abusar del revive)
Excelente juego con una gran historia

Summary:
This is a fucking great game. It's a shooter with satisfying and fantastic gunplay, and a very good story/characters. The story can sometimes get a little too much, but is still great and, fundamentally, the game is very fun and absorbing.

At the end of the day, Bioshock Infinite is a shooter, and as a shooter it is very, very fun. It has this perfect balance of making you feel invincible without actually being easy- that is to say, you will die if you don't play well, but the game absolutely succeeds in making you feel like a badass. It's extremely satisfying. The landscape you're fighting in and beautifully made and detailed, and the worldbuilding is excellent. This really adds to the gameplay: it feels like you're playing in a world with real character rather than just an empty sandbox. The general atmosphere, something which is very hard to do well in a game, is extremely absorbing, similar to another game- Dishonoured, one of my favourites of all time. They really nailed it here. The characters are also very good and mostly genuinely interesting to hear, and the story is very well made and a major component of the game which distinguishes it from other shooters.

The game has its flaws. For example, you are given plenty of guns and vigours (i.e. special abilities/powers) to use in order to try and simulate a 'play your own way' approach. This sort of works, and allows the player to use a weapon which feels satisfying to them, but you'll generally be using the same 2-4 weapons the whole time because, although there are maybe a dozen, around 6 of them are actually good. A few of the special abilities feel a little underwhelming as well. The game would benefit a LOT from a greater number of both to properly realise the vision of the player being able to utilise any play-style. The story, whilst good, can sometimes get a little too much: what I mean by this is that whilst I do believe it's a well-written story, it excessively talks about 'quantum particles' and 'alternate realities' without really explaining them. The ending, whilst it does make sense and is a good twist, confused many because it can be difficult to follow just what the story is talking about. 

These problems are sort of marginal, though. You might notice them occasionally, but personally what I really thinking throughout the game was mostly either 'wow this is fun' during gunplay or 'wow this is cool' when just browsing the beautiful level-scapes. I strongly recommend this game. As an introduction to the singleplayer FPS genre, it is excellent. If you've enjoyed games like Dishonoured, Prey, Metro, Wolfenstein, or Far Cry it'd be stupid NOT to get this game. 

Each playthrough is about 10h and because the opening/ending scenes are so long (as they're used to drive the story) you probably won't be bothered to start a second playthrough immediately due to not wanting to go through the long opening exposition again. This is definitely a flaw, but give it a while like I did and you can certainly enjoy the game again. Because of the 10h playthrough time, maybe get it on sale (like I did), but if it is on sale absolutely pick it up.

推薦程度: 超出預期

遊戲類型: FPS
遊玩難度: 中等
遊戲性: 9/10
探索性: 7/10
觀賞性: 8/10

簡評: 完美地把生化奇兵系列提升到另一層次, 前半段就像是一部迪士尼電影一樣的冒險之旅, 後半段回歸系列節奏, 結局來個神逆轉, DLC再把故事和第一集連結起來, 充滿新鮮感卻味道依然, 新系統讓戰鬥部份更加精彩, 唯一缺點是可攜帶武器實在太少

Worse in every way.

NEGATIVES

- Can no longer carry more than two weapons at a time
- No manual save feature, all autosaves and the autosaves are sometimes spaced out up to an hour apart. If you're actually interested in exploring you can get screwed over very easily. How is it possible to fuck this up?
- Powers all feel gimped and lifeless compared to their Bioshock 1 and 2 counterparts, pretty sure shock jockey only immobilizes enemies for one full second.
-No more hacking, best you get is the ability to make robots a temporary ally but if you don't kill them by the end of the duration they'll just turn on you again.
- Weapon Upgrades are no longer visually represented on your weapons making them much less interesting and turning every upgrade in to a boring stat boost (e.g. +2 Machine Gun)
- No more Gene Tonics and no equivalent instead you get a "Gear" system where you can arbitrarily only equip 4 items at once which arbitrarily are filtered in to different slots further gimping creative playstyles in an already barren game.
- Can no longer carry Healing Kits or Salts, forcing you to constantly get chewed away at by hitscan bulletsponge enemies while searching every inch of the floor for crumbs or a puddle of Salts you can slurp up before they blast your head off.
- No player choice, not even minor player choice. Saving or harvesting Little Sisters in the old games was kind of a shallow way of introducing morality and alternate endings but to remove all player choice entirely seems insane. I get to pick a bird or a cage necklace though! Yay..?
- Oh, also, no alternate endings.
- Elizabeth is hateable from both a character and gameplay perspective. I've watched her walk through walls, objects, people, and most annoyingly of all back and forth in front of whatever thing I happen to be trying to read, the "finding things" mechanic she has is also annoying, she never shuts up. I would understand and actually like it if she were just finding real items in the environment that I may have overlooked then I might actually feel like she's helping me but that isn't what she's doing. As far as I can tell she's magically pulling these things out of her ass or a tear or whatever stupid logic Ken Levine wants to use. I almost feel like this was a way to get around putting more effort in to the item placement in levels because if there's not whatever item you would actually need around you right now Elizabeth can just magic it the fuck up so we're good. Why allow you to actually carry equipment to prepare yourself for an engagement? Hahahaha that would just be craaaaazy!
- Researching enemies is gone. Thing that's been around since System Shock 2 they felt the need to eliminate. WHY NOT GET RID OF THE AUDIO LOGS TOO WHILE WE'RE AT IT KEN?!?!???!
- Buggy. I've found doors that go out of the map. I've watched enemies spawn in front of my face. I've killed enemies and had their bodies despawn in front of me and not even leave a loot container. I've watched enemies stand in place and stare at me just waiting for death. 10/10 experiences!
- Disposable lockpicks are horseshit and I feel like they're only here to try and get you to subconsciously feel like Elizabeth is actually useful and to try and convince you to spend more of your time exploring the boring empty maps so you can sit and look at all the neat setpieces someone at the company spent way too much time on. 
- No Map. Didn't even include a Map. Another thing a game from 30 years ago got right that this didn't somehow. Are you guys devolving? Now we're stuck with a "GO THERE" giant fuck off arrow. Great. 
- Story is offensively patronizing (RACISM BAD, WOMEN VOTING GOOD, NATIONALISM BAD, PATRIOTISM BAD, COMSTOCK EVIL BECAUSE EVIL) either they think their audience is small children or they think we're all dumb, can't tell which is worse. 

POSITIVE
+ Looks nice

That concludes my TED talk, thank you for coming.

I first saw this game eight years ago, on a borrowed PC Gamer magazine. I never thought that I’d be able to play the game, let alone finish it. After a while, I got a proper rig to play games and bought this game. Didn’t play this game much until I took a break from playing games.[/i]


I have just started playing again last week and finished the story today.[/spoiler]


What can I say? I'm at a loss for words. No wonder it's rated as overwhelmingly positive. It's rare for me to finish a game and end up sighing, taking a breath and lie back, all while muttering mild profanities due to your amazement of the product. The ending is just magnificently bittersweet. [/spoiler]


Right before the story ends, you will also visit Rapture, a nod to the first two Bioshock games. This is quite interesting, especially if you have played both games before.[/spoiler]


Bioshock Infinite [/b]is an absolute piece of digital [/spoiler]masterpiece[/b]. Incredible writing and storytelling combined with impeccable voice acts. [/spoiler]


It's [/spoiler]worth [/b]the [/spoiler]full price [/b]and a [/spoiler]no-brainer during sales[/b].[/spoiler]

Es un juego de disparos básicamente, pero con entornos fantásticos, que llaman la atención y absorben los sentidos de manera eficiente. En el intento de descubrir la mejor estrategia contra cada enemigo, se puede uno pasar el tiempo sin sentir. La trama y el ambiente atrapan.

Looks beautiful, plays smoothly, gameplay is awesome and the story is absolutely magnificent (though it can be a bit confusing if you don't pay good attention). All around a good singleplayer game that will last you for approximately 10 hours of play time (excluding downloadable content).
